tldr: The article investigates the metabolism of [1-13C]-glucose in Paracoccus denitrificans using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. The results show that the Entner-Doudoroff pathway and the pentose phosphate pathway are operative under the specified growth conditions, with 31% and 69% of the glucose metabolized through these pathways, respectively. The study concludes that the Embden-Meyerhoff pathway does not operate in vivo.
